# General Parameters

## Calibration Adjustment K-Factors

The calibration adjustment k-factors reset to 1, as shown in @tbl-k-factors.
```{python}
#| label: tbl-k-factors
#| tbl-cap: K-Factors
#| echo: False
from IPython.display import Markdown
from tabulate import tabulate
table = [['Salt Lake to Utah County' , 'Work'    ,'SL_UT_KFAC_Wrk', 1.00],
         ['Salt Lake to Utah County' , 'Other'   ,'SL_UT_KFAC_Oth', 1.00],
         ['Salt Lake to Utah County' , 'Truck'   ,'SL_UT_KFAC_Trk', 1.00],
         ['Salt Lake to Utah County' , 'External','SL_UT_KFAC_Ext', 1.00],
         ['Salt Lake to Davis County', 'Work'    ,'SL_DA_KFAC_Wrk', 1.00],
         ['Salt Lake to Davis County', 'Other'   ,'SL_DA_KFAC_Oth', 1.00],
         ['Salt Lake to Davis County', 'Truck'   ,'SL_DA_KFAC_Trk', 1.00],
         ['Salt Lake to Davis County', 'External','SL_DA_KFAC_Ext', 1.00],
         ['Weber to Box Elder County', 'Work'    ,'WE_BE_KFAC_Wrk', 1.00],
         ['Weber to Box Elder County', 'Other'   ,'WE_BE_KFAC_Oth', 1.00],
         ['Weber to Box Elder County', 'Truck'   ,'WE_BE_KFAC_Trk', 1.00],
         ['Weber to Box Elder County', 'External','WE_BE_KFAC_Ext', 1.00]]

merged_rows = []
prev_row = [''] * len(table[0])
merge_cols=[0] # index of which columns to include in merging

for row in table:
    merged_row  = row.copy()
    for idx, c in enumerate(row):
        if idx in merge_cols:
            if row[idx]==prev_row[idx]:
                merged_row[idx]  = ''
    merged_rows.append(merged_row)
    prev_row = row

Markdown(tabulate(merged_rows,
  headers=['County-to-County Pair','Purpose','Code','Value']))


```
